utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been having difficulties breathing over these last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When did it start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It started about, like, three or four days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and since then, has it gotten any better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It has, maybe gotten a little bit worse, but not, maybe, a little worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And are there certain times when you feel that you're more short of breath than other times? Anything in particular that you're doing that makes it worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, not really, it's kind of, I just feel like, it's just more difficult to breathe, uh, most of the time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, has this happened to you before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, not like, no, nothing like this has happened before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have a history of any lung problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't, I've been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So no COPD, no asthma, nothing like that,  right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're just having difficulties breathing for the past three-four days. Do you have any, uh, do you have a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did have a, uh, yeah, I've had a cough as well, over these last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And has it been a dry cough or wet cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been bringing up, some, like, uh, whitish sputum. It's like, yeah, whitish or clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And you haven't seen blood anytime right? In your sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has the cough gotten any worse overtime?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it's been about the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have felt hot but no chills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. What about, any redness in your eyes or any congestion in your nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it's felt a little itchy I guess but no pain with swallowing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you have any chest pain or chest pressure?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, when I like, uh, take a deep breath or after after I cough I've been having some chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: To give it a number from one to ten, what would you say in terms of how severe it is with ten being the worst pain ever.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say, maybe six. It feels pretty sharp when it happens and it goes away after a few minutes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where exactly is it, is the pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I kind of feel it, Yeah, just over on the right side of the sternum.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, and does it radiate anywhere? Does it go anywhere other than that one location?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I feel it just in the one spot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and has that pain gotten worse overtime?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that pain started, I guess like two days ago. More recent than the cough or shortness of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, I see, OK. And so you said that coughing makes it worse and sometimes breathing in. So is it just normal breathing or when you're doing like, deep breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Deep breathing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Deep breathing hurts? OK. Alright, and you've never experienced this before, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had a pain like this before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when you sort of touch that area over your chest, does touching it make it worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no, I haven't noticed that, touching it doesn't make it worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, alright, have you had a headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. What about fatigue or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been fatigued. No muscle aches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any pain in your belly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your, uh, any changes when you pee?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, nothing there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK. Any rash that you've noticed on your skin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any changes in your sense of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright. So sounds like for the past three-four days you've had difficulties breathing and a cough with this whitish sputum, whitish or clear sputum. You've also been feeling a little bit feverish. Have you checked your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't. I don't have a thermometer at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, no problem and your throat's been a little bit itchy and then two days ago you also started having this pain in your chest. Is there any other symptom that I have not mentioned that you have been experiencing over the past couple of days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's everything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. And you mentioned that you don't have a history of asthma or COPD. Do you have any other medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have high blood pressure. And I take Amlodipine, for that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any other over the counter medications or any other medication that you're on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where do you currently live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: In a townhouse just outside of the city here.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, do you live alone?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I live with my wife and daughter.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have your wife and daughter been sick recently or have either of you had contact with someone who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been working from home, uhm, but my daughter has recently started going back to high school and she's had a runny nose recently and a sore throat, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And what about your wife?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She's been fine. Yeah, she's been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good. Other than your daughter, have you been in contact with anyone else who might have, who might be sick or might have symptoms similar to what your daughter has?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, and do you, have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been just, uh, working from home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ever smoked in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never smoked before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I mean, I'll have a joint sometimes with friends at a party or something, but that's maybe once a month?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure, and any street drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have a beer a couple of times per week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and you told me about your medical history, but do you have, have you ever had any surgeries or any hospitalizations in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I've had a hernia repair, about seven years ago. I haven't had any issues since.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, OK, uhm, and are there any medical conditions that run in your family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, my grand-father had a heart attack, in his seventies. And, I think my dad has high blood pressure as well, but, I think that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, well, so, I think that's all that I wanted to know. I can see that you haven't been feeling well over the past couple of days and I'll go back to my attending and we will come back and chat with you little bit more and do a physical exam and go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sounds good, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
